headline: Mike Gibbons: Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is because of the weakness of the Biden Administration
sentences: I believe in an American foreign policy built along Ronald Reagan’s adage of “peace through strength.” That doesn’t mean we should be involved in civil wars and internal disputes around the world.
The United States must immediately reimpose President Trump’s strong sanction regime against Russia and ensure that our NATO allies in Europe are prepared to respond to any further aggression.
He removed Trump’s sanctions on Nord Stream 2 and President Biden’s disastrous withdrawal from Afghanistan last summer sent a message of weakness to bullies around the world.
President Trump shut down Putin’s Nord Stream 2 pipeline while simultaneously expanding our own domestic oil and gas production to make American energy independent.
On his first day in office, President Biden shut down the American Keystone XL pipeline — an infrastructure project critical to American energy independence.
Rather, it means we should project strength, speak clearly, commit troops to battle only in defense of the United States of America, and always fight to win.
Sadly, the Biden Administration has turned its back on the Reagan approach, undermined the progress made during the Trump years, and emboldened our enemies.
Putin’s economy was in a choke hold, the price of gas and home heating fuel was low, and the expansionism of tyrants around the world was curtailed.
Our military has been stretched too thin over the past two decades, often in the cause of taking sides in other countries’ civil wars.
However, the crisis in Ukraine is a rekindling of a thousand-year old dispute that involves ethnic, religious and language divides.
What we’re seeing in Ukraine right now just underscores the point that a weak and indecisive America puts the world at risk.
His column does not necessarily reflect the opinion of The Lima News editorial board or AIM Media, owner of the newspaper.
As tough as it is to view the scenes from Ukraine, I am resolved: no American troops should be deployed to Ukraine.
Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is an act of unprovoked aggression and must not stand.
Mike Gibbons is a Cleveland businessman currently running for the U.S. Senate in Ohio.
For four years, under the leadership of President Trump, Russia was held in check.
The world is a safer place when America is strong, resolved, and respected.
No American member of our military should die in defense of Ukraine.
We know from history that appeasement never works.
We are not committed by treaty to defend them.
Our allies need to be able to trust us.
Sadly, that is no longer the case.
Ukraine is not a member of NATO.
That changed in January 2021.
Our enemies need to fear us.
This is not our fight.
